definition[0]: something that you must do as a formal or official part of an activity or process
example[0]: the formalities necessary for a valid marriage
definition[1]: something you must do even though it has no practical importance or effects
example[1]: Getting a gun license here seems to be just a formality.
definition[2]: careful attention to polite behaviour and language in formal situations
example[2]: There is always some degree of formality when one speaks to a stranger.
example[3]: The loan was arranged with little formality.
definition[3]: something formal or official that you have to do so that a process can be completed properly
example[5]: Certain formalities have to be completed before the legal transfer can take effect.
definition[4]: something that has to be done for official reasons but will not have any real effect on something that has already been planned or agreed
example[6]: It will only be a formality to renew the agreement on a long-term basis.
example[7]: Although the sale still requires the approval of the Chinese government, such approval is a mere formality.
